net.gree.asdk.api.ui
Class ScreenShotButton

java.lang.Object
  ImageButton
      net.gree.asdk.api.ui.ScreenShotButton

public class ScreenShotButton
extends ImageButton

ScreenShotButton This extends ImageButton. When clicked this will take a screenShot from the root view, and create a ShareDialog with the application name as message. You can find this view by searching for android:id="id/screenshot_button" e.g : 

 
 ScreenShotButton button = (ScreenShotButton) findViewById(R.id.screenshot_button);
 button.setOnClickListener(new OnClickListener() {
    public void onClick(View view) {
          ShareDialog shareDialog = new ShareDialog(getContext());
          shareDialog.setMessage("This is my message");
          shareDialog.setImage(ScreenShot.capture(getRootView()));
          shareDialog.show();
    }
  });

Author:
GREE, Inc.

Method Detail

setShareDialog

public void setShareDialog(ShareDialog shareDialog)
Set the ShareDialog that will be called when clicking on the button Note that this is optional, if you do not call this, a new ShareDialog will be created.

Parameters:
shareDialog - the shareDialog to be called

getShareDialog

public ShareDialog getShareDialog()
Get the ShareDialog that is called when clicking on the button, this is null until the button is clicked once.

Returns:
the last used ShareDialog.
